result.markdown:
---
title: "Z score homework"
author: "Jamesy V"
format: 
  html: 
    code-fold: true
    code-tools: true
    output-fold: true
---



Given that a population of scores has a mean of 110 and a standard deviation of 8.

Graph it



::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Z-score-homework_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



What percentage of scores are below a score of 99?



::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Z-score-homework_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



Calculate the answer



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
z = (99 - 110)/8
pnorm(z)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 0.08456572
```


:::
:::



What percentage of scores are above a score of 115?



::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Z-score-homework_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-4-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



Calculate it



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
z = (115 - 110)/8
1.00 - pnorm(z)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 0.2659855
```


:::
:::



What percentage is associated with a score of 85?



::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Z-score-homework_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-6-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



Calculate it



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
z = (85 - 110)/8
pnorm(z)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 0.0008890253
```


:::
:::



## Comparing Carol's Exam Scores

At the end of the quarter Carol took four final exams. The mean and standard deviation for each exam along with Carol’s grad on each exam are listed here. Assume that the grades on the exam are normally distributed.

### French class 

Class mean = 75.4

Class sd = 6.3

Her score = 78.2

Calculation



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
z = (78.2 - 75.4)/6.3
pnorm(z)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 0.6716394
```


:::
:::



Carol performed 67.16% better than the rest of her class in French

Let's look at the graph



::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Z-score-homework_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-9-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



### History class

Mean = 85.6

sd = 4.1

Her score = 83.4

Calculation



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
z = (83.4 - 85.6)/4.1
pnorm(z)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 0.295777
```


:::
:::



Carol performed better than 30% of her classmates



::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Z-score-homework_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



### Psychology class

Class Mean = 88.2

sd = 3.5

Her score = 89.2

Calculate it



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
z = (89.2 - 88.2)/3.5
pnorm(z)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 0.6124515
```


:::
:::



Carol performed better than 61.24% of her class



::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Z-score-homework_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-13-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



### Statistics class

Class mean = 70.4

sd = 8.6

Her score = 82.5



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
z = (82.5 - 70.4)/8.6
pnorm(z)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 0.9202829
```


:::
:::



Graph it



::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Z-score-homework_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-15-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



## Hospital

A hospital in a large city records the weight of every infant born at the hospital. The distribution of weights is normally shaped with a mean of 2.9 kilograms and a standard deviation of 0.45.

Graph



::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Z-score-homework_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-16-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



### What percentage of infants weighed less than 2.1 kilograms?

Graph it



::: {.cell}
::: {.cell-output-display}
![](Z-score-homework_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-17-1.png){width=672}
:::
:::



Graph it

•    What is the percentile rank of ao weight of 4.2 kilograms?

•    What percentage of infants weighed between 1.8 and 4.0 kilograms?

•    Challenge: If 15,000 infants have been born at the hospital how many weighed less than 3.5 kilograms?
